com.samsung.android.sdk.shealth.tracker

Class TrackerTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.shealth.tracker.TrackerTile

  • public final class TrackerTile
extends Object
    This class defines the tracker tile.

    Tracker Tile Template

    Samsung Digital Health SDK provides 3 tracker tile templates. Each tile template is designed for its proper usage and different tile templates can be chosen whenever your application posts the tracker's tile.

    The tile can have the tile intent to jump to its tracker when user selects the tile on the main screen.
    The background color of the tracker tile is fixed in the platform but some properties of the tracker tile can be colored separately.

    Refer to Tracker Design Guidelines for more information. You can find it in the downloaded SDK's /SHealthService/Docs folder.

    Tracker Tile Type 1

    TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_1 is useful when you need to show the tracker tile without health data. It contains a button for the specific action that starts or stops a tracking session, measures health data newly, or updates health data.
    The following properties are included. Properties marked with * indicates ones that can change color according to your design.

    Property Description
    Icon Representative icon resource
    Title* Title of the tracker tile
    Button The followings can be set for the button.
    • Button text
    • Button Intent

    The designated color is applied to the button background.*

    Tracker Tile Type 2

    If there is data value to show and no need of a button, use TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_2.
    It contains the following properties. Properties marked with * indicates ones that can change color according to your design.

    Property Description
    Icon Representative icon resource
    Content value* Numeric content value to be shown
    Content unit* Unit of the content value.
    It's optional.
    Title* Title of the tracker tile
    Date Measured time information for data of the tracker tile

    Tracker Tile Type 3

    TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_3 contains a button for the specific action additionally as compared with TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_2.
    Use TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_2 if you don't need a button on the tile.
    It contains the following properties. Properties marked with * indicates ones that can change color according to your design.

    Property Description
    Icon Representative icon resource
    Content value* Numeric content value to be shown
    Content unit* Unit of the content value.
    It's optional.
    Title* Title of the tracker tile
    Date Measured time information for data of the tracker tile
    Button The followings can be set for the button.
    • Button text
    • Button Intent

    The designated color is applied to the button background.*

    Localizing Tracker Tile

    If your application is released to several target countries, the following information of your tracker tile needs to be localized with related languages. Add translated text for related languages to your application's string resources.

    • Title
    • Button Text

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrackerTile

        public TrackerTile(Context context,
                   String trackerId,
                   String tileId,
                   int tileType)
        Constructs a new TrackerTile instance with the tile ID for the specific tracker.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of your application
        trackerId - The specific tracker ID of the tracker manifest.
          E.g. "tracker.test" is the tracker ID if the tracker is defined as shown below. 
           <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
 <resources>
 <string name="testtracker_manifest">
 {
     \"tracker\" : {
         \"id\" : \"tracker.test\",
         \"display-name\" : \"tracker_test_display_name\",
         \"icon\" : \"tracker_test_icon_big\",
         \"controller\" : \"com.samsung.android.app.plugintracker.MyTracker\"
     }
 }
 </string>
 </resources>
        tileId - The tile ID to be define.
          The following characters are not allowed for the tile ID.
          • Escape sequence : \t, \r, \n, \f, \b
          • XML reserved words : <, >, &
          • Space and dot(".")
        tileType - One of the following tracker tile types.
        • TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_1
        • TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_2
        • TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_3
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parameter is null or invalid
        Since:
        1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • setTitle

        public TrackerTile setTitle(int title)
        Sets a title of a tracker tile.

        If your application covers various countries, add translated title text for related languages to your application's string resources.

        Parameters:
        title - A resource ID of the title in the application's package of the string to use. Its maximum length is 15.
        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies the title
        Throws:
        Resources.NotFoundException - Thrown if the title resource cannot be found
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the title resource is invalid
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setIcon

        public TrackerTile setIcon(int icon)
        Sets an icon of a tracker tile.
        Parameters:
        icon - A resource ID of the icon in the application's package.
        Check if the icon size keeps the following ranges.

        Size Description
        Height 60 dp if the tile type is TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_1, or
        30 dp for other types
        Width Same size of the height or more, less than 136 dp.
        Make your tracker to be in harmony with other S Health's tiles.

        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies the icon
        Throws:
        Resources.NotFoundException - Thrown if the icon resource cannot be found
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the icon resource is invalid or its size is not proper
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setContentValue

        public TrackerTile setContentValue(String contentValue)
        Sets the numeric content value to show tracker tile information.
        It is optional.
        Parameters:
        contentValue - A numeric content value of the tracker tile. Its maximum length is 7.
        If its length is long, the content unit can be cropped in the tracker tile. Check your tracker tile on S Health Simulator or S Health to prevent it.
        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies the content value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parameter is invalid
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setContentUnit

        public TrackerTile setContentUnit(String contentUnit)
        Sets the content unit of the content value.
        Parameters:
        contentUnit - A content unit of the tracker tile. Its maximum length is 5.
        If its length is long, the content unit can be cropped in the tracker tile. Check your tracker tile on S Health Simulator or S Health to prevent it.
        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies the content unit
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parameter is invalid
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setDate

        public TrackerTile setDate(Date date)
        Sets the date and time related to display data on the tracker tile.
        It needs not to be considered as the posting time of the tracker tile and usually indicates the data's measurement time.
        Parameters:
        date - The date and time of measured data on the tracker tile
        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies the date
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parameter is invalid
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setContentColor

        public TrackerTile setContentColor(int contentColor)
        Sets the color for the following properties of the tracker tile. Applicable properties are different depending on the tracker tile type.

        • Title
        • Content value
        • Content unit
        • Button background

        Parameters:
        contentColor - The content color of applicable properties
        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies the content color
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setContentIntent

        public TrackerTile setContentIntent(int intentType,
                                    Intent intent)
        Sets a content intent to be sent when the tracker tile is performed.
        Parameters:
        intentType - One of the following intent types.
        • INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY
        • INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE
        intent - The intent to fire, which is defined in your application
        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies content intent
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parameter is invalid
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setButtonIntent

        public TrackerTile setButtonIntent(CharSequence title,
                                   int intentType,
                                   Intent intent)
        Sets a button intent to be sent when the tracker tile button is clicked.

        If your application covers various countries, add translated button text for related languages to your application's string resources.

        Parameters:
        title - Text describing the action. Use all capital letters. Its maximum length is 14.
        intentType - One of the following intent types.
        • INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY
        • INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE
        intent - The intent to fire, which is defined in your application
        Returns:
        The tracker tile object that applies button intent
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parameter is invalid
        Since:
        1.0.0
